p: Verify that Apache is configured to use only strong SSL ciphers.
Using strong encryption algorithms with SSL helps reduce the risk of successful eavesdropping attacks and helps with regulatory compliance.
To verify that Apache is configured to use only strong SSL ciphers, view the httpd.conf files and check the following settings: "SSLProtocol" and "SSLCipherSuite". The recommended settings are:
These settings enable only the TLS protocol and only the strong encryption cipher suites.

html:
Applies To

  • Web Applications
  • Apache

What to Check For

Verify that Apache is configured to use only strong SSL ciphers.

Why

Using strong encryption algorithms with SSL helps reduce the risk of successful eavesdropping attacks and helps with regulatory compliance.

How to Check

To verify that Apache is configured to use only strong SSL ciphers, view the httpd.conf files and check the following settings: "SSLProtocol" and "SSLCipherSuite". The recommended settings are: 


SSLProtocol -all +TLSv1
SSLCipherSuite HIGH:!aNULL:!SSLv2:!MD5:@STRENGTH
SSLHonorCipherOrder on

These settings enable only the TLS protocol and only the strong encryption cipher suites.

It may also be a good idea to check for the following line in case of old versions of apache/mod_ssl: 


SSLInsecureRenegotiation off

How to Fix

To use only strong SSL algorithms, edit the httpd.conf file to include the following settings: 


SSLProtocol -all +TLSv1
SSLCipherSuite HIGH:!aNULL:!SSLv2:!MD5:@STRENGTH
SSLHonorCipherOrder on

These settings enable only the TLS protocol and only the strong encryption cipher suites.

It may also be a good idea to include the following line in case of old versions of apache/mod_ssl: 


SSLInsecureRenegotiation off
